summary: Makes atronachs properly flamey looking with most ENB setups
descriptionHtml:
Flame atronachs.  Your first serious Conjuration summon.  You summon it up, and... it looks awful!  Too dark, its "flames" look way too deep red-orange.  That doesn't look like flame!  After fiddling, you discover that Your ENB setup is doing it, and nothing short of shutting off major components of ENB can correct it.  It doesn't even seem to respond properly to the fire settings in the ENBSeries INI.

Enter me, one rather well-versed in NIFSkope surgery.  I noticed that the flame trail that Madame de Flambedaedra leaves in her wake is not so affected.  After poking at the two NIFs, I discovered that it was a shader flag lacking in the main flame atro mesh that was present in the flame trail: SLSF1_Soft_Effect.  After setting all pertinent bits on the main flame atro body mesh to have that shader flag, presto!

Sharing for all of you who are partial to siccing daedra against your foes and also have an ENB setup.

Special thanks to Boris Vorontsov for ENBSeries, and for Jonwd7 for his recently revealed massive in-progress overhaul of NIFSkope (I call it "Super-NIFSkope", it's that big a deal), to which you can get a piece of from here: [url=https://github.com/jonwd7/nifskope/releases]https://github.com/jonwd7/nifskope/releases[/url]
